member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocol
member.summary: The class represents a network protocol installed on a client instance that allows communication with the instance of SQL Server over a network.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocol.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the referenced protocol.
member.returns: A value that specifies the display name of the protocol.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocol.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the property that specifies whether the client network protocol is enabled or disabled.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the client network protocol is enabled or disabled.If True, the client network protocol is enabled.If False (default), the client network protocol is disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocol.NetLibInfo
member.summary: Gets the network library information file for the referenced protocol.
member.returns: A object value that specifies the network library information file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocol.NetworkLibrary
member.summary: Gets the network library file name for the referenced protocol.
member.returns: A value that specifies the network library file name for the referenced protocol.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocol.Order
member.summary: Gets or sets the order in which the referenced protocol is listed and applied in relation to the other currently supported protocols.
member.returns: An value that specifies the order of the referenced protocol in the list of currently supported protocols.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocol.Parent
member.summary: Gets the object that is the parent of the object.
member.returns: A object that is the parent of the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocol.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the objects and properties on the object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocolCollection
member.summary: The class represents a collection of objects that represent all the client protocols defined on the parent object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ClientProtocolCollection.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified key value exists in the collection.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the key value exists in the collection.If True, the key value exists in the collection.If False, the key value does not exist in the collection.
member.param: A value that specifies the key value to check the existence of in the collection.

An value that specifies the index position to start the copy.

member.summary: Gets the number of objects in the referenced collection.
member.returns: An int32 value that specifies the number of objects in the referenced collection.

member.summary: Gets an enumerator that can iterate through the list of objects.

member.summary: Gets a object in the collection by name.

member.summary: The class represents an attribute of a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) client protocol.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ManagedComputer
member.summary: The class represents a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) installation on an instance of Microsoft SQL Server.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified computer name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ManagedComputer.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified computer name and the specified login and password.

A value that specifies the user name.
A value that specifies the password.

A value that specifies the user name.
A value that specifies the password.
The value that specifies the provider architecture type.

member.summary: Represents a collection of objects. Each object represents a client protocol defined on the WMI installation.
member.returns: A object that represents all the client protocols defined on the WMI installation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ManagedComputer.ConnectionSettings
member.summary: Gets the connection settings for the referenced WMI installation.
member.returns: A object that represents all the connection settings defined on the WMI installation.

member.summary: Gets the object with the specified Uniform Resource Name (URN) address.
member.returns: A object that represents the object with the specified URN address.

member.summary: Represents a collection of objects. Each object represents a server alias defined on the WMI installation.
member.returns: A object that represents all the server aliases defined on the WMI installation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ManagedComputer.ServerInstances
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects. Each object represents an instance of SQL Server defined on the WMI installation.
member.returns: A object that represents all the server instances defined on the WMI installation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ManagedComputer.Services
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects. Each object represents a SQL Server service defined on the WMI installation.

member.summary: Gets the version information for the network library file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.Service
member.summary: The class represents an instance of the SQL Server service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.Service.AcceptsPause
member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the SQL Server service can be paused.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the SQL Server service can be paused.If True, the service can be paused.If False (default), the service cannot be paused.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.Service.AcceptsStop
member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the SQL Server service can be stopped.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the SQL Server service can be stopped.If True, the service can be stopped.If False (default), the service cannot be stopped.

member.returns: A object that represents all the advanced properties defined on the SQL Server service.
